skill.name: sparc-methodology
skill.description: SPARC (Specification, Pseudocode, Architecture, Refinement, Completion) comprehensive development methodology with multi-agent orchestration
skill.summary: SPARC (Specification, Pseudocode, Architecture, Refinement, Completion) comprehensive development me...
skill.author: Claude Flow

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown content describing a development methodology. No executable code, network calls, filesystem access, or environment variable usage. All content describes declarative patterns for MCP tool usage.

content.value_statement: Complex software projects lack structure. SPARC provides a five-phase framework from specification to completion with 17 specialized modes for coordinated multi-agent development. Teams achieve 2.8-4.4x speed improvements through parallel execution and systematic quality gates.
actual_capabilities: Execute five-phase development workflow: Specification, Architecture, Refinement, Review, Completion
Choose from 17 specialized modes including researcher, architect, coder, tdd, reviewer, optimizer
Coordinate parallel multi-agent swarms with hierarchical, mesh, ring, or star topologies
Apply Red-Green-Refactor TDD cycles with 90% minimum test coverage
Store and retrieve architectural decisions via persistent memory integration
Monitor swarm execution and track progress across agent sessions
limitations: Requires claude-flow MCP tools for actual execution (not included in skill)
Cannot execute code or run tests directly - coordinates agents that perform work
Terminal commands shown require npx claude-flow installation to function
Best results achieved within Claude Code or compatible Claude environments

use_cases.title: Coordinate team development
use_cases.description: Orchestrate multiple agents working on backend, frontend, database, and tests in parallel with dependency management

use_cases.title: Apply structured workflow
use_cases.description: Follow systematic phases from requirements through deployment with built-in quality gates and documentation

use_cases.title: Automate quality checks
use_cases.description: Run automated security scans, performance analysis, and best practices validation on pull requests

prompt_templates.title: Start development
prompt_templates.prompt: Use SPARC methodology to develop [feature description]. Start with researcher mode to gather requirements, then architect mode for design.

prompt_templates.title: Apply TDD cycle
prompt_templates.prompt: Run tdd mode to implement [feature] with 90% test coverage. Follow Red-Green-Refactor cycle.

prompt_templates.title: Coordinate swarm
prompt_templates.prompt: Initialize hierarchical swarm with [number] agents. Spawn architect, coder, tester, and reviewer agents to work on [project] in parallel.

prompt_templates.title: Review and optimize
prompt_templates.prompt: Run reviewer mode with security and performance checks on [code]. Then use optimizer mode to address any bottlenecks found.

output_examples.input: Use SPARC methodology to build a user authentication API
output: Research phase: Researcher agent gathers JWT and OAuth best practices
Architecture phase: Architect agent designs REST endpoints with security patterns
Implementation phase: Coder agent implements Express API with test-driven approach
Testing phase: TDD mode creates 90%+ coverage test suite
Review phase: Reviewer agent validates security and performance
Documentation phase: Documenter creates OpenAPI specification

best_practices: Always batch all related operations in a single message for parallel execution efficiency
Use memory integration to share architectural decisions across agent sessions
Maintain minimum 90% test coverage and document all architecture decisions
Use hierarchical swarm topology for complex projects with clear delegation chains
anti_patterns: Avoid spreading related work across multiple messages - this breaks parallel coordination
Do not skip the research and architecture phases before implementation
Avoid using minimal implementation mode in production without proper refactoring
Do not skip security checks during the review phase

faq.question: Is claude-flow required to use this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill describes workflows that require claude-flow MCP tools or CLI. Install via npm first.

faq.question: What test frameworks does TDD mode support?
faq.answer: Jest, Mocha, and Vitest for unit tests. Playwright and Cypress for end-to-end testing.

faq.question: Can SPARC integrate with existing CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. Documenter mode generates CI/CD ready documentation. GitHub integration available via MCP tools.

faq.question: How is my code and data protected?
faq.answer: SPARC is a methodology skill with no execution capabilities. Code stays in your environment via agent tools.

faq.question: Why are my parallel agents not coordinating properly?
faq.answer: Ensure all related operations are in one message. Use TodoWrite for task tracking. Check memory namespace consistency.

faq.question: How does SPARC compare to traditional development methods?
faq.answer: SPARC combines TDD with multi-agent orchestration for 2.8-4.4x speed gains while maintaining 90%+ test coverage.
